page.title: 12History
page.content: Although the whole of the Furness area gives evidence of settlement and occupation since pre-historical times, very little is known for certain, and there are almost no traces with-in the D-Block of pre-Norman life (although the church is named St. Cuthbert's and owns a Saxon muniment chest and a Saxon tombstone). There is a Norman doorway in the church, and there is a mention in the original Domesday Book of {"Cherchebi Manor"}(Kirby-in-Furness). The reference,in fact,is believed to relate to the period around 1060 when it was held by Earl Tostig, brother to King Harold the First-the same brother killed at the battle of Stamford Bridge fighting{against} Harold.
